result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Heacox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon R. Heacox in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe states matters are resolved.  State states recs.  Atty Raabe agrees and guilty pleas entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement.  Atty Raabe makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

15CM646
Ct 1:  Guilty

16CM189
Ct 1:  Dismissed
Ct 2:  Dismissed
Ct 3:  Guilty

18 months probation on each count concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
$443.00 (16CM189) and $543.00 (15CM646) costs/surcharges to be paid today to Clerk of Court's Office or set up payment plan w/Clerk of Court's Office 
Absolute sobriety at all times
Counseling per agent
Not to engage in any violent or abusive contact with anyone
Any other conditions per agent
Any cash bonds to be applied
DE to report to P&P by 3:30 today
Return date on June 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon R. Heacox in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke requests resets as she's unsure why DE isn't here.  State agrees.  Court resets, bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety and no violent/abusive contact w/anyone

Defendant Brandon R. Heacox in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  State requests absolute sobriety at all times and no violent/abusive contact w/anyone.  DE responds that he has a problem w/alcohol but he will try to comply w/the bond conditions as requested.  Court orders $150 cash bond continued w/special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times and no violent/abusive contact w/anyone.  Court advises DE to go to PD's office today and reapply for this matter too so Ms. O'Rourke can be appointed.  Return date scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
